transliteration: Chakitan Channdan|| Dhaktan Indan|| Taktan Devan Bhagtan Bhevan||427||
translation: The moon was wondering and Indra, seeing their devotion, had been fearful; all the gods were looking at them.427.

transliteration: Bhramtan Bhootan|| Lakhitan Roopan|| Chakratan Chaaran|| Suhridan Saaran||428||
translation: The ghosts, fiends and ganas, seeing their beauty were wonder-struck; and all were thinking about them with sincerity.428.

gurmukhi: nlnI sUAM ]liK AauDUAM ]ct dy Ctw ]BRm qy jtw ]429]
transliteration: Nalnisooan|| Lakh(i) Audhtan|| Chat De Chhataa|| Bhram Te Jataa||429||
translation: The Yogi Dut saw there a parrot, who was released from bondage and immediately flew away.429.

gurmukhi: qikqM dyvM ]bikqM ByvM ]ds nv sIsM ]krm kdIsM ]430]
transliteration: Takitan Devan|| Bakitan Bhevan|| Das Nav Seesan|| Karam Kadeesan||430||
translation: As soon as the pious Dutt saw him, he flew away and made known to Dutt this secret that the action-prone man with ten senses and none doors was superior amongst beings.430.

transliteration: Budhitan Dhaamannd|| Grihitan Baamannd|| Bhramtan Mohan|| Mamtan Mohan||431||
translation: He is the abode of wisdom, but falling in the attachment of his wife etc. he remains in illusion.431.

transliteration: Mamtaa Buddhan|| Srihatan Logadg|| Ahitaa Dharman|| Lihitah Bhogadg||432||
translation: The individual entrapped in the key of wisdom and mildness, he is absorbed in pleasure and is removed far away from Dharma.432.

transliteration: Grastan Buddhan|| Mantaa Maatan|| Istrinehan|| Poutra Bhraatan||433||
translation: His wisdom seized by the attachment of mother, wife, sons and brothers.433.

transliteration: Grastan Mohan|| Dharitan Kaamannd|| Jalatan Krodhan|| Palitan Daamannd||434||
translation: Engrossed in lust, he is absorbed in attachments and burning in the fire of anger, he is occupied in the collection of wealth.434.

transliteration: Dalatan Byodhan|| Takitan Daavan|| Antah Narkan|| Gadtah Paavan||435||
translation: On getting an opportunity, he destroys the great warriors for his self-interest and in this way, he falls into hell.435.

transliteration: Tajitan Sarban|| Grahitan Ekan|| Prabhatan Bhaavan|| Tajitan Dvaikhan||436||
translation: If forsaking all, the Lord is adored with sincerity, and then all the sufferings and malice come to an end.436.

gurmukhi: nilnI suik jXM ]qijqM idrbM ]sPlI krmM ]lihqM srbM ]437]
transliteration: Nalinisouk(i) Jyan|| Tajitan Dirban|| Saphalikarman|| Lahitan Sarban||437||
translation: If the being relinquishes all like the abandonment of the cage by parrot, then all his actions can bear fruit and he achieves the position of superiority.437.

gurmukhi: ieiq nilnI suk aunIsvoN gurU brnnM ]19]
translation: End of the description of the adoption of the Parrot as the Nineteenth Guru.
Now begins the description of the adoption of a Trader as the Twentieth Guru
